newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIA SEES 1997 SUGAR BEET OUTPUT UP TO 90,000T.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIA SEES 1997 SUGAR BEET OUTPUT UP TO 90,000T.

text.p: Bulgaria's Agriculture Ministry forecasts 1997 sugar beet output at up to 90,000 tonnes, compared to 53,000 tonnes in 1996 but still below the target of 120,000 tonnes, a ministry official said on Thursday.
The official told Reuters the target announced by the ministry in February would not be met because of low purchasing prices and lack of interest among the producers.

"This figure will not be reached and between 80,000 and 90,000 tonnes of sugar beet will be produced this year as farmers have difficulties obtaining funds due to the country's general economic crisis," the official said.
A ministry plan for 1997 set the sugar beet area at 8,000 hectares, but the official said that only 4,900 ha had been planted.
Bulgaria's sugar output fell by 64 percent in 1996 due to bad weather in the spring.

With the expected output, Bulgaria, which used to meet nearly 50 percent of its sugar needs with local production, is expected to supply its sugar-processing plants with less than 10 percent of their needs. -- Sofia Newsroom +359-2 981 4145
